Package org.ejbca.util.query

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejbca.util.query.Query
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class Query
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A class used to produce advanced queries from the user data and approval tables. It's main function is getQueryString which returns a string which should be placed in the 'WHERE' clause of a SQL statement.
    Version:
    $Id: Query.java 25704 2017-04-18 14:42:43Z jeklund $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query​(int type)
        Creates a new instance of Query
        Parameters:
        type - is the type of query to produce. Should be one of the 'TYPE' constants of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(Date startdate,
                Date enddate)
        Adds a time restraint to the query. Both parameter cannot be null This method should only be used in ra user queries.
        Parameters:
        startdate - gives the start date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        enddate - gives the end date of the query or null if it no startdate.

      • add

        public void add​(int matchwith,
                Date startdate,
                Date enddate)
        Adds a time restraint to the query. Both start and enddate parameters cannot be null This method should only be used in ra user queries.
        Parameters:
        matchwith - should indicate which field to match with, on of the TimeMatch.MATCH_WITH constants.
        startdate - gives the start date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        enddate - gives the end date of the query or null if it no startdate.

      • add

        public void add​(Date startdate,
                Date enddate,
                int connector)
        Adds a time restraint and a connector to the query. Both parameter cannot be null. This method should only be used in log queries.
        Parameters:
        startdate - gives the start date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        enddate - gives the end date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        connector - should be one of the 'CONNECTOR' constants.

      • add

        public void add​(int matchwith,
                Date startdate,
                Date enddate,
                int connector)
        Adds a time restraint and a connector to the query. Both start and enddate parameters cannot be null. This method should only be used in ra user queries.
        Parameters:
        matchwith - should indicate which field to match with, on of the TimeMatch.MATCH_WITH constants.
        startdate - gives the start date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        enddate - gives the end date of the query or null if it no startdate.
        connector - should be one of the 'CONNECTOR' constants.

      • add

        public void add​(int matchwith,
                int matchtype,
                String matchvalue)
         throws NumberFormatException
        Adds a match of type UserMatch or ApprovalMatch to the query.
        Parameters:
        matchwith - should be one of the the UserMatch.MATCH_WITH or LogMatch.MATCH_WITH constants depending on query type.
        matchtype - should be one of BasicMatch.MATCH_TYPE constants.
        matchvalue - should be a string representation to match against.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if there is an illegal character in matchvalue string.

      • add

        public void add​(int matchwith,
                int matchtype,
                String matchvalue,
                int connector)
         throws NumberFormatException
        Adds a match of type UserMatch or ApprovalMatch and a connector to the query.
        Parameters:
        matchwith - should be one of the the UserMatch.MATCH_WITH or ApprovalMatch.MATCH_WITH depending on query type.
        matchtype - should be one of BasicMatch.MATCH_TYPE constants.
        matchvalue - should be a string representation to match against.
        connector - should be one of the 'CONNECTOR' constants.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if there is an illegal character in matchvalue string.

      • add

        public void add​(int connector)
        Adds a connector to the query.
        Parameters:
        connector - should be one of the 'CONNECTOR' constants.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if there is an illegal character in matchvalue string.

      • getQueryString

        public String getQueryString()
        Gives the string to be used in the 'WHERE' clause int the SQL-statement.
        Returns:
        the string to be used in the 'WHERE'-clause.

      • isLegalQuery

        public boolean isLegalQuery()
        Checks if the present query is legal by checking if every match is legal and that the number of connectors is one less than matches.
        Returns:
        true if the query is legal, false otherwise

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the current query string
